author: Staff Reporter
text:
Four persons including two women had a miraculous escape when a TNSTC town bus plunged into a roadside pond near Boothapandi Government Hospital in the early hours of Saturday.

The driver of the town bus operating between Siramadam and Nagercoil, who left Siramadam around 5.30 a.m. in the morning, lost control of the vehicle allegedly due to brake failure. The bus dashed against a roadside tree before plunging into a roadside pond near the Government Hospital in Boothapandi.

The two women passengers and the bus crew had a miraculous escape with minor injuries.

As soon as the bus plunged into the pond, people nearby rushed to the spot and rescued the women and the bus crew before the police and Tamil Nadu Fire and Rescue Services personnel reached the spot.

R.Sorna (29) and M. Ruby (59) of Siramadam, the bus driver M. Bharat Manikumar (29) of Melaperuvilai and A. Masoodhan (25) of Kannanvilai near Chenbagaramanpudur sustained injuries.

Mr. Bharat Manikumar and Ms. Sorna were admitted to the Kanyakumari Government Medical College Hospital while Ms. Ruby and the conductor Masoodhan have been admitted to the Government Hospital in Boothapandi.

The condition of the injured was said to be ‘stable,’ hospital sources said.
title: TNSTC bus plunges into pond
